title: Stephens' Cornerstone Speech
quote: Our new government is founded upon... the great truth that the negro is not equal to the white man; that slavery... is his natural condition.

title: Mississippi Declaration of Secession
quote: Our position is thoroughly identified with the institution of slavery... a blow at slavery is a blow at commerce and civilization.

title: Dixiecrat Platform
quote: We stand for the segregation of the races... We oppose the elimination of segregation, the repeal of miscegenation statutes.
attribution: States' Rights Democratic Party, Birmingham Convention

title: Thurmond Switches Parties
quote: The Democratic Party has abandoned the people... [The Civil Rights Act is] the worst, most unreasonable and unconstitutional legislation that has ever been considered.
attribution: Sen. Strom Thurmond announcing switch to GOP

title: Goldwater Votes Against Civil Rights Act
quote: The Constitution does not permit any discrimination of any kind... But it is also true that the Constitution recognizes... the freedom to associate or not to associate.
attribution: Sen. Barry Goldwater, Senate floor speech explaining his vote against the Civil Rights Act

title: Southern Strategy Explained
quote: You start out in 1954 by saying 'n----r, n----r, n----r.' By 1968 you can't say that... So you say stuff like forced busing, states' rights... now you're talking about cutting taxes.

title: The Southern Manifesto
quote: We pledge ourselves to use all lawful means to bring about a reversal of this decision [Brown v. Board] which is contrary to the Constitution.
attribution: 101 Southern Congressmen, Declaration of Constitutional Principles

title: Wallace's 'Segregation Forever' Inaugural
quote: Segregation now, segregation tomorrow, segregation forever!
attribution: George Wallace, Alabama Gubernatorial Inaugural Address

title: Reagan's Neshoba County Speech
quote: I believe in states' rights... I believe we have distorted the balance of our government today by giving powers that were never intended to be given in the Constitution to that federal establishment.
attribution: Ronald Reagan, Neshoba County Fair, Mississippi (near where civil rights workers were murdered in 1964)

title: Mississippi Constitutional Convention
quote: We came here to exclude the negro. Nothing short of this will answer.
attribution: Judge Solomon Calhoon, President of the Mississippi Constitutional Convention of 1890

title: Mississippi Black Codes
quote: All freedmen, free negroes and mulattoes... with no lawful employment... shall be deemed vagrants, and on conviction thereof shall be fined.
attribution: Mississippi Vagrant Law, one of the Black Codes passed immediately after the Civil War

title: Crittenden Compromise Rejected
quote: No amendment shall be made to the Constitution which will authorize or give to Congress the power to abolish or interfere... with slavery.
attribution: Sen. John Crittenden's proposed constitutional amendment, rejected because the South demanded MORE protections for slavery

title: Justice Harlan's Plessy Dissent
quote: Our Constitution is color-blind, and neither knows nor tolerates classes among citizens.
attribution: Justice John Marshall Harlan, lone dissenter in Plessy v. Ferguson

title: Frederick Douglass: 'What to the Slave is the Fourth of July?'
quote: What, to the American slave, is your 4th of July? I answer: a day that reveals to him, more than all other days in the year, the gross injustice and cruelty to which he is the constant victim.

title: Lincoln's First Inaugural
quote: I have no purpose, directly or indirectly, to interfere with the institution of slavery in the States where it exists. I believe I have no lawful right to do so, and I have no inclination to do so.
attribution: Abraham Lincoln, attempting reconciliation before the South started the war anyway

title: LBJ's 'We Shall Overcome' Speech
quote: Their cause must be our cause too. Because it is not just Negroes, but really it is all of us, who must overcome the crippling legacy of bigotry and injustice. And we shall overcome.
attribution: President Lyndon Johnson, Address to Congress on Voting Rights

title: Hiram Revels' First Senate Speech
quote: I maintain that the past record of my race is a true index of the feelings which today animate them... they bear toward their former masters no revengeful thoughts, no hatreds, no animosities.
attribution: Hiram Revels, first Black U.S. Senator, addressing those who opposed seating him
